resources.string: Tachibana
Settings
Language
Notification
Sound Effect
Soft Horror
* Some scenes may become intense.
Credit
Quit
Enable BGM
Select BGM
Unlocked on Day 21
Edge Panel Position
Left
Right
Default
Day 21
User: (‚Ä¶)
User: Haa‚Ä¶ did I give up again‚Ä¶?
unknown: Hey!
User: ?!
unknown: What are you doing?!
User: Who are you?!
Chibihana: It is me! Chibihana!
User: Still, who?!
Chibihana: I\'m Tachibana\'s little sister! I\'ve always been here with you!
User: ???
Chibihana: More importantly! I\'ve been watching you and you were trying so hard! Why did you give up?! I\'m gonna smack you!
(She is strong-willed‚Ä¶)
User: I do not know‚Ä¶ it is not like I meant to press it myself‚Ä¶ it just felt like I was being drawn in‚Ä¶ it is an excuse, I know‚Ä¶
Chibihana: Hmm‚Ä¶ sounds like you are saying nonsense‚Ä¶ is that what dependency is? No excuses!
(She is really strong-willed‚Ä¶)
Chibihana: (‚Ä¶)
Chibihana: Do not you think dependence and cooperation are kind of similar?
User: Huh?
Chibihana: What you are trying to quit now probably started as something harmless.
Chibihana: More like a support to help you live, like a brace for your spirit.
Chibihana: Maybe when work was tough, or after a heartbreak‚Ä¶
Chibihana: Something you started to fill a hole in your heart‚Ä¶
Chibihana: It was not supposed to be essential, but over time, you became dependent on it.
Chibihana: Like jamming a fake key into a lock.
User: ...
Chibihana: Dependency is like sitting alone at the bottom of a dried-up well, waiting for someone to bring you water.
Chibihana: You cannot fetch water yourself anymore.
Chibihana: You are scared to climb out, and you do not even want to see the sky.
Chibihana: But you believe, surely someone will come down and bring me water.
Chibihana: That is your only hope.
Chibihana: When someone actually comes and gives you water,
Chibihana: You cling to them with all you have got, thinking they are your savior.
Chibihana: Saying, Without you, I will dry up and die.
Chibihana: But in truth-
Chibihana: Unless I go fetch it myself, this well will never be filled.
Chibihana: Deep down, you know that.
Chibihana: But you still cannot move.
Chibihana: That numbness itself is what dependency really is.
(I got nothing to say‚Ä¶)
Chibihana: If you do not have the courage to climb out alone, me and big sis will help. With the three of us, you can do it, right?
User: Are you dependent on anything?
Chibihana: Of course‚Ä¶ on my sister! She is smart, can play guitar, cute, and sometimes silly! She is my idol! But it is a good kind of dependence!
User: I see‚Ä¶ is she dependent on something too?
Chibihana: Who knows? I cannot imagine her being dependent on anything.
Chibihana: Maybe once, a long time ago! But now‚Ä¶ maybe on me? We are codependent!
Chibihana: But we are not like those dumb salamanders! We will have a better ending!
(That is not what codependency means‚Ä¶)
(But maybe I can overcome it‚Ä¶ if it is with them, no matter how painful‚Ä¶)
Chibihana: Come on! Tomorrow awaits, young one! A bright tomorrow!
[BAD_END]
Tachibana: "I have something to tell you."
Tachibana: "You made it through 30 days. You overcame so many temptations."
"Honestly, at first I thought you were some kind of enlightened sage‚Ä¶"
Tachibana: "Remember the story about the salamander on Day 14? They're actually kind of cute. Oh, and my Japanese outfit‚Äîdidn't it look good on me?"
Tachibana: "Around Day 21, I started to get anxious. If you overcame your addiction‚Ä¶ I thought maybe you'd leave me."
"So I tried to win you over with my secret triple fried rice technique. You loved it. I basically crushed it, didn't I?"
"On Day 28, I tried to suppress my feelings‚Ä¶ But I couldn't. If it meant not losing you‚Ä¶"
"I wished you would suffer with your addiction forever and live here with me, in this cave. Like a salamander locking up a frog‚Ä¶ That's why I did such things‚Ä¶"
"But you overcame your addiction‚Ä¶ You got past everything‚Ä¶"
"Or so I thought?"
"No, that's not it. You didn't really think that, did you? You just replaced your addiction‚Äîwith me. You just switched what you depended on."
"Maybe this is how it should have been from the start‚Ä¶ I love you. And you, loving me, came to depend on me. Now I depend on you too."
"Did you think the frog couldn't escape? Of course it could. It just had to leave while the salamander was asleep. Maybe it was more comfortable here than you‚Äôd expect."
"And you thought the same, didn't you? That this place is more comfortable than you expected."
"You could have left anytime, but you kept coming back to see me. And now, here we are, having this happy ending."
"I'm happy‚Ä¶ Thank you‚Ä¶ for depending on something, for trying to overcome it‚Ä¶ That's how we met."
"From now on, we'll always, always be together."
BAD END: The Frog and the Salamander in the Water Prison
You: "Huh?! What? Did I press reset or something?!"
Tachibana: "Nishishishi‚Ä¶"
Tachibana: "It was me!"
You: "Whaaat, Tachibana?! Why would you do that?! That's so mean!"
Tachibana: "It's not mean!"
You: "I'll decide if it's mean or not!"
Tachibana: "Nope, I decide! The mean one here is you!"
You: "Stop with the Gian-isms! Show some compassion!"
Tachibana: "Anyway! Do you know why I did it?"
You: "Uhh‚Ä¶ Maybe because the look on someone's face when their hard work crumbles makes food taste better or something?"
Tachibana: "And what if I said‚Ä¶ you're right?"
You: "I have no clue! Why would you do something so awful?!"
Tachibana: "Because I wanted to talk to you! That's why I did it! Sorry‚Ä¶?"
You: "Ah‚Ä¶ I see‚Ä¶"
Tachibana: "You haven't said a single word to us since you got here."
You: "‚Ä¶That's true."
Tachibana: "Are you shy? You don't look like the shy type."
You: "Yeah, I guess not. I've never been shy in my life. My younger brother, though‚Äîhe's *super* shy."
Tachibana: "Huh‚Ä¶ quite the genetic contrast you two have."
Tachibana: "Hmm‚Ä¶ I still don't know why you came to our place, though."
You: "Is this place, like‚Ä¶ hell or something?"
Tachibana: "How rude! Why would you assume hell of all places? At least call it heaven, even if you don't mean it!"
Tachibana: "But honestly, I don't really know either. What counts as heaven or hell?"
Tachibana: "You don't seem to remember much, huh?"
You: "Not everything. Just how I got here, that part is missing."
Tachibana: "Huh. That only happened to you, you know. My sister and I remember just fine."
You: "Really‚Ä¶? Well, whatever. I guess I'll just enjoy this world. It's not like it's some other world, right?"

Tachibana: "I don't know. I mean that literally. Who knows what's a real world or a fantasy one? I've lived in Japan, even spent time in Australia‚Äîpart of Oceania‚Äîbut maybe this is the other world to *you*."
Tachibana: "Maybe you're someone's ideal‚Ä¶ or maybe you're trying to become it‚Ä¶"
You: "If that's true‚Ä¶ living is a strange thing."
Tachibana: "Yep. Life has been strange since 3.8 billion years ago."
Tachibana: "But hey, you seem okay. That's good! See you! Maybe in four days?"
You: "Four days?"
Tachibana: "Yup. By the way, did you try pressing reset at least once?"
You: "No idea. Why?"
Tachibana: "‚Ä¶Well, you should try it once, at least! Okay, see ya!"
Heeey, over here‚Äîcan you see me?
Heeey, are you alive?
Are you drinking water?
Breathing air?
Your face kinda looks like a sage already.
Is quitting really that hard? My little sister had a hard time too‚Ä¶ with ice cream. She ate so much‚Ä¶
One time, some stranger bought it for her‚Ä¶ in Australia‚Ä¶
Prices were high there, and while she stood frozen in front of the freezer‚Ä¶
Old man: \"Ice cream‚Äôs expensive, huh, little lady‚Ä¶\"
Old man: \"I‚Äôll buy it for you!\" And he did. In English, of course.
Well, she‚Äôs cute so I get it. I‚Äôd want to buy it too.
Now though, fear of the dentist outweighs it all. Pain beats craving. Kinda important, huh?
Maybe you need to learn pain too? Want me to teach you? Everyone has a weakness, right‚Ä¶
‚Ä¶Ahaha, just kidding. Congrats on Day 7!
"Chibi Hana dreams of catching a marlin."
Chibi Hana is walking happily... Let/‚Äôs follow her.
I don/‚Äôt really know much about her. We/‚Äôve only spent a few days together.
What I do know is that she has an abnormal obsession with ice cream and an unhealthy love for Tachibana.
She used to live in Australia.
Well, so did Tachibana though.
She says she wants to become a man of the sea.
She/‚Äôs strong-willed. A tomboy. Completely different from Tachibana.
What... What/‚Äôs she doing with that serious face?
Is she doing a karate kata? In the middle of town? Tachibana can/‚Äôt even do a single sit-up. Not cut out for martial arts.
Chibi Hana can do karate too? ...Wait, is that a groin strike? What kind of scenario is she imagining...? Maybe point-stop karate?
In any case, these sisters are multi-talented. I/‚Äôve never seen anyone do karate in public, let alone a girl.
Where is she going next?
Ah‚Äî! She/‚Äôs eating ice cream! I thought you quit that?!
You: "Didn/‚Äôt you quit ice cream?!"
Chibi Hana: "Whoa! You scared me!"
Oops... I said that out loud.
You: "You said you were quitting because of cavities!"
Chibi: "Sh-shut up!!"
Chibi: "More importantly‚Äîwhat the heck?! Were you following me?! I can/‚Äôt believe it! "
chibi„ÄåI/‚Äôll sue! Officer! Some man is stalking a little girl here!„Äç
You: "Stop it! Don/‚Äôt say stuff you don/‚Äôt mean!"
Chibi: "What are you even doing here?!"
You: "Uh‚Ä¶ yeah, I was actually following you."
Chibi: "So it wasn/‚Äôt even a lie?! This is real! Officer! Seriously! Someone call a man!"
You: "Please stop! I/‚Äôll seriously get arrested!"
You: "Honestly, I was just curious. Tachibana/‚Äôs always around, but I wondered what you were up to."
Chibi: "Creep... Why should you care what I do...?"
Chibi: "...Wait. You saw my kata too, didn/‚Äôt you? HYAH!"
You: "GYAAAH!"
So that/‚Äôs what the groin strike was for... Is she really a little girl?! The weak sister of Tachibana?!
Did she inherit all the physical stats in their gene pool? Maybe she/‚Äôs actually from a different parent‚Ä¶ like half-gorilla?
Chibi: "Shut up already! My parents are NOT gorillas!"
You: "How do you even know that?!"
...10 minutes later
Awkward. I mean, this is mostly my fault.
Chibi: "..."
Chibi: "Well, I guess I can chat with you now. Consider it compensated dating. But pay me an allowance first."
Chibi: "Also, I won/‚Äôt sue you."
Chibi Hana: "Technically, following a minor without consent‚Äîno matter the reason‚Äîcan be considered stalking."
Chibi Hana: "I/‚Äôm a minor, you know? No parental consent. You/‚Äôd be violating both the Child Welfare Act and Youth Protection Ordinances. But I/‚Äôll let it slide."
You: "...You sound... way more mature than I expected."
Chibi: "What are you talking about? I just use big words I/‚Äôve learned. You/‚Äôre the one assigning /‚Äòappropriate/‚Äô behavior to each age group."
Chibi: "Even my age can handle tough words. Darcy-Weisbach formula. Polyvagal theory. I know them, so I use them."
A fluid dynamics equation in neuroscience?! She/‚Äôs too smart!!
You: "Do you have something you want to be when you grow up?"
Chibi: "I/‚Äôm glad you asked... I want to be... Santiago!"
Chibi: " I want to be... Santiago!"
You: "Who?"
Chibi: "‚Ä¶‚Ä¶!"
Chibi: "Do you even have a brain‚Ä¶?"
You: "Why do I deserve that kind of insult?!"
Chibi: "Hemingway! The Old Man and the Sea! The legendary fisherman!"
You: "Ahhh."
Right, Santiago is the protagonist in that novel‚Äîa weathered fisherman.
You: "The guy who caught the marlin, right?"
Chibi: "Well yeah, if that/‚Äôs your surface-level understanding."
You: "What do you admire about him?"
Chibi: "How he lives apart from society. His unshakable values. And he doesn/‚Äôt brag /‚ÄòI really caught that marlin!/‚Äô‚Äîplus, he probably doesn/‚Äôt use social media."
You: "That/‚Äôs... surprisingly refined."
Chibi: "He fought a marlin for three days. That/‚Äôs not something most people can do. And when the sharks ate the catch, he didn/‚Äôt boast‚Äîhe just went to sleep."
Chibi: "He/‚Äôs a man/‚Äôs man. Like a Matryoshka doll‚Äîevery layer you peel away, he/‚Äôs still a man. Even the core."
Chibi: "You/‚Äôd totally say something like /‚ÄòBelieve me, I really caught it!/‚Äô Then post it to Twitter."
...Yeah, I/‚Äôd definitely post it. Hoping it goes viral.
Chibi: "That/‚Äôs why I/‚Äôll be a man of the sea too! I will become one!"
What a strong character‚Ä¶!
Chibi: "I once joined a hagfish catching crew‚Äîjust for a bit. It was super exciting."
Chibi: "It was in Eden, Australia. Immigrant trainees live onboard a huge ship with a visa! Massive one!"
Chibi: "Though hagfish are usually caught with traps, so it/‚Äôs not like Santiago/‚Äôs one-on-one battles."
You: "Interesting! Are hagfish eaten in Japan?"
Chibi: "Not really. They look gross. Most fishermen treat them as garbage. They/‚Äôre all slimy and annoying."
Chibi: "But they do eat them in Korea. Busan, I think. And China too, maybe. Ask my sister‚Äîshe/‚Äôd know more."
You: "Huh, I/‚Äôve probably never seen one then."
Chibi: "They taste like cartilaginous fish. Like stingray."
You: "Wait, stingrays are edible?"
Chibi: "Of course! Only the spines are poisonous. But if you leave it out, it smells like ammonia. So chill it right away in ice."
Chibi: "And the liver/‚Äôs edible raw, but there/‚Äôs this nasty sac called /‚Äòsmell bomb/‚Äô‚Äîyou have to remove it."
Chibi: "It/‚Äôs easy to cut. Tastes amazing. You can even use scissors for part of it. The liver tastes like raw beef liver."
Chibi: "The fins, fried, are crispy and chewy‚Äîlike that chicken cartilage you get at izakayas."
You: "Huh‚Ä¶ I really don/‚Äôt know anything. I/‚Äôve never even gone fishing. The bait/‚Äôs just‚Ä¶ gross."
Chibi: "It/‚Äôs easy! I/‚Äôll put the bait on for you!"
Ugh‚Ä¶ I feel pathetic.
Chibi: "Then it/‚Äôs settled! I/‚Äôm going home for now, but if you keep up your abstinence‚ÄîI/‚Äôll take you fishing!"
You: "Really?! Awesome! I/‚Äôll look forward to it!"
Tachibana is reading a book‚Ä¶ and wearing traditional clothes‚Ä¶ how rare‚Ä¶
You: "What are you doing?"
Tachibana: "Reading a novel, by Masuji Ibuse."
You: "Why the traditional clothes?"
Tachibana: "Well‚Ä¶ it's kind of my way of showing respect."
"Like not showing up to a party in sandals ‚Äî I felt I should be formal before a work full of soul."
You: "What‚Äôs the story about?"
Tachibana: "It's like a picture book‚Ä¶ but overlaps with modern society. Feels like a prophetic fairy tale. It's called 'Sanshouo'."
Tachibana: "The name supposedly comes from its pepper-like smell."
"In the West, there were rumors it breathed fire. Well, it does look like a lizardman."
Tachibana: "A real salamander probably wouldn‚Äôt grow big enough to get stuck in a cave, but‚Ä¶"
"A giant salamander might. They can reach 150cm. Super cute. They're carnivorous amphibians that eat anything."
Tachibana: "Hey, listen‚Ä¶"
"In the story, the salamander traps a frog in the cave‚Ä¶ kind of out of spite. The frog dies at the end."
"Even then, the frog says, 'I'm not angry at you.'"
"Would you not be angry even if I locked you away too?"
Yeah‚Ä¶ If it‚Äôs you, I‚Äôd be glad to‚Ä¶
No, I want to be independent.
Tachibana: "I see‚Ä¶"
Tachibana: "In this story, both the one who traps and the one trapped‚Ä¶ neither can get out."
Tachibana: "‚Ä¶Doesn't that sound a bit like dependency?"
(Tap to return)
Tachibana: "Welcome back! Good job today! I put effort into tonight‚Äôs dinner. I even ran the bath for you!"
You: "Thanks."
Her in an apron is a refreshing sight.
Tachibana: "I'll cook today! Look forward to it!"
You: "‚Ä¶What are you doing?"
Tachibana: "What do you mean?"
You: "Why‚Äôs the cutting board on the floor? And you‚Äôre kneeling?"
Tachibana: "Why? Because I‚Äôm Japanese‚Ä¶"
I‚Äôve never seen anyone actually do that!
Also that has nothing to do with being Japanese!
You: "‚Ä¶What are you doing?"
Tachibana: "What do you mean?"
Are we repeating the same scene?
You: "Why are you cracking eggs while kneeling?"
Tachibana: "Because I‚Äôm making fried rice."
I wasn‚Äôt asking why you‚Äôre cracking eggs‚Ä¶
You: "‚Ä¶What are you doing?"
Tachibana: "What do you mean?"
Yup. We\'re definitely in a time loop.
You: "Wait‚Äîthis is dangerous! Are you seriously going to keep doing this while kneeling?!"
Tachibana: "Just be quiet and watch."
‚Ä¶Incredible. She flipped the pan blind‚Äîwhile kneeling. And she`s holding it with both hands!
Tachibana: "It‚Äôs done!"
You: "Why are there three plates of fried rice?"
Tachibana: "Why not? One‚Äôs already happiness. Triple fried rice is triple the joy!"
You: "Why are they sitting directly on the floor again?"
Tachibana: "Because we‚Äôre Japanese! You‚Äôre supposed to eat kneeling!"
You: "And you're using a spoon?"
Tachibana: "Obviously. Chopsticks are too hard. You're Japanese too, right? So am I."
You: "What about veggies?"
Tachibana: "No need. I hear their screams. Main dish: fried rice. Side: fried rice. Soup? Fried rice."
You: "And the screams of the Peking duck?"
Tachibana: "It‚Äôs delicious, so I chew through the screams too."
You: "What‚Äôs this one?"
Tachibana: "Drinkable fried rice. I got it at the convenience store. It‚Äôs called ‚ÄòZenbu Ireban.‚Äô"
You: "I‚Äôm speechless."
Tachibana: "It literally says 'NOMU CHAHAN' in romaji. Like‚Äîwho is that even for? Also, it's misspelled."
She\'s right‚Ä¶ it\'s spelled ‚ÄòCHAHAN.‚Äô
You: "Can I even eat all this? Even the drink is fried rice‚Ä¶"
Tachibana: "Don‚Äôt worry. They all taste different. And all of them are seriously good."
You: (She‚Äôs right‚Ä¶ Every one of these is insanely good. Even the drinkable one! Why?!)
Tachibana: "Was it good?"
You: "Yeah. It was unbelievably good. Why? How?"
Tachibana: "When you get into fried rice, it becomes a passion. I want to try ice fried rice next."
‚Ä¶She might actually pull it off. Ice fried rice‚Äîmadness made real.
You: "Thanks for the meal. That was the best fried rice I‚Äôve ever had. I‚Äôll wash the dishes."
Tachibana: "No no, I‚Äôll take care of it!"
Tachibana: "Oh, right!"
Everything‚Äôs ready for tomorrow too! I‚Äôve laid out your shoes to be easy to walk in. Room humidity is optimized.
The lighting temperature fits your current parasympathetic state too.
Given today‚Äôs sweat level, it should take around 20 minutes to wash from the back of your head to your toes, right?
So‚Ä¶ your bath should be done by 8:55 PM.
After that, you‚Äôll watch that drama you like on YouTube, right?
‚Ä¶But watching too much of that isn‚Äôt good for your brainwaves, you know?
Melatonin gets suppressed. Especially when other women show up, right?
Other women suppress melatonin too, you know?
You‚Äôre only allowed to watch super macho movies like Expendables!
Ah! But skip the scenes with Megan Fox! She‚Äôs too pretty!
I‚Äôll take care of you forever and ever, until the day you enter your coffin! That‚Äôs what‚Äôs best for everyone!
‚Ä¶Hey. It‚Äôs okay if I keep taking care of you like this, forever‚Ä¶ right?
Yeah. I\'m happy too.
You don‚Äôt have to force yourself.
‚Ä¶The desk is a complete mess.
‚Ä¶On the desk&cigarettes. Alcohol. And‚Ä¶ is that a gambling magazine?
‚Ä¶I don\'t understand. This isn‚Äôt like her. These things aren\'t her hobbies.
"I set all this up."
You see, I don\'t want you to overcome your addictions. Because if you do, you\'ll leave me, won\'t you? You don\'t have to quit at all.
Let\'s just live together, nice and warm, in this lukewarm hell of ours.
Heaven is dull. Hell, on the other hand, must be bursting with laughter. But to truly enjoy life in hell, you need something‚Äîa thread, a glimmer of hope.
That\'s why you need something to depend on. You could just depend on me. Would\'t that be fine?
Go ahead‚Äîdrink, smoke, gamble, whatever you want. Just do it.
And if you can\'t‚Ä¶ then lean on me. That\'s the best way. Isn\'t it?
Yes
No
Hey‚Ä¶
If it means we have to part ways,
then maybe you don\'t have to overcome your addiction, right?
Tachibana: "I have something to tell you."
Tachibana: "You made it through 30 days. You overcame so many temptations."
"At first, I thought some kind of sage had shown up‚Ä¶ your face looked so exhausted!"
Tachibana: "We talked about salamanders on Day 14. They're actually kind of cute."
"Oh, and my kimono‚Äîdidn't it look good on me?"
Tachibana: "Around Day 21, I started getting anxious‚Ä¶ If you overcame your addiction, maybe you'd leave me."
"So I tried to win your heart with triple fried rice. You praised it so much. I crushed it‚Äîyour appetite."
"On Day 28, I tried to suppress my feelings‚Ä¶ but I couldn‚Äôt."
"If losing you was the price‚Ä¶ I wanted you to suffer with addiction and stay with me in the cave forever."
"Like a salamander locking up a frog‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs why I did what I did."
"But you overcame your addiction‚Ä¶ you got through everything‚Ä¶"
"Ah‚Ä¶"
"A shooting star‚Ä¶"
"I wish it'd let me know before flying off‚Ä¶"
"It always goes too fast to make a wish."
"‚Ä¶Wasn't the beginning really hard for you?"
"Your hands trembled sometimes‚Ä¶ Your face looked so pale‚Ä¶"
"And now? Do you feel reborn? No. That's always been you."
"You didn‚Äôt change. You've been like this since the start."
"But then‚Ä¶ life happened. Society hit you, hurt you, unfairly."
"You got wounded, and to cover the pain, you became dependent on something."
"It's not your fault. Life is just hard to begin with."
"Not that I have any right to preach‚Ä¶"
"I couldn‚Äôt handle losing you either‚Ä¶ and so I did what I did‚Ä¶"
"By the way, 30 days isn‚Äôt actually enough to fully form a habit."
"It takes about 66 days for something new to stick completely."
"But you've reached the start line. 30 days is easy now, right? With us."
"Yeah‚Ä¶ I just want you to stay with me‚Ä¶"
"Hehe‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs okay now. I won‚Äôt be mean anymore‚Ä¶"
"I won't lock you up again."
"This time, let‚Äôs find a way out together‚Äîjust the two of us. Or the three of us."
"Or maybe, let's find a way to enjoy this cave together."
"Come on, let‚Äôs go. From now on, let‚Äôs stay together!"
Tap again to go back.
Just kidding.
Hey‚Ä¶
Why are you trying to leave?
You could just stay here forever.
There‚Äôs nothing good waiting for you out there.
Tap again to go back.
You can go back.
You can‚Äôt go back.
(This one will be shown as a modal)
I said, you can‚Äôt go back.
‚Ä¶So you‚Äôre really leaving after all.
Welcome!\nI\'m Tachilada!
Let\'s do our best together!
Start
Your goal is‚Ä¶
How many calories/money can you save per day?
When did you quit?
What?
Calories
kcal

You cannot select a future time.
My goal is to be able to do one sit-up!!
You can leave calories and amount blank!
Set the time to a point in the past!
There\'s a character limit for your goal!
Once you fill in the required fields, our story begins!
Choose carefully
Normal Mode
Narrative Mode
Are you sure you want to proceed?
Yes. That‚Äôs the right choice.But it would be boring.
I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it‚Ä¶ but if you‚Äôre determined‚Ä¶
Proceed
Back
You came back again.
Thank you so much for playing this far.\nBut Danchibana‚Äôs journey isn‚Äôt over yet.\n‚îÄ‚îÄI‚Äôll be waiting to see you again.
See you
Tap again to go back
The portrait changes from time to time
Exiting on the second tap

Seven days reached! You did great. There‚Äôs still a long way to go, but take a moment to take a deep breath.
Did you know? ‚ÄúThe sound of water‚Äù calms the amygdala in your brain. ‚Ä¶So now, it‚Äôs okay to feel a little at ease.
They say human heartbeats can synchronize with the person you‚Äôre touching. ‚Ä¶Then I‚Äôll quiet down with you.
Apparently plants ‚Äúfeel‚Äù sound and grow. I‚Äôm sure you‚Äôre growing in unseen ways too.
Watching fire calms us down‚Äîit‚Äôs instinctual. ‚Ä¶So today, how about watching a candle video?

Do you know Hanaoka Seish≈´? In the Edo period, he was the physician who performed the world‚Äôs first general anesthesia surgery. ‚Ä¶But the first person who helped test that anesthetic was his mother.
Seashells are said to reflect sounds at a frequency that calms people. So when you hold one to your ear and hear the ocean‚Ä¶ maybe it‚Äôs the waves of your own heart.
Dandelion fluff navigates air currents better than airplanes. ‚Ä¶Even though it‚Äôs so small, riding the wind is amazing, isn‚Äôt it?
Artemia‚Äôs dormant eggs have a chitinous shell and vitrified trehalose that completely block out moisture. They can survive a thousand years in slumber‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm envious.
Astrocytes look like stars in the brain, but they‚Äôre actually the ‚Äúcleanup crew‚Äù for neurotransmitters. They‚Äôre deeply linked to depression. Yet no one ever sees them.
For some reason, cuckoos lay their eggs in other birds‚Äô nests. This brood parasitism is genetically ingrained, not ‚Äúmalicious.‚Äù Who decided that it was ‚Äúbad‚Äù?
The sky on Mars doesn‚Äôt look blue. It‚Äôs not Rayleigh scattering but Mie scattering caused by dust‚Ä¶ Under that orange-pink sunset, what will you remember?

The more we want something, the more we push it away‚Äîthat‚Äôs human nature. When approach and avoidance fire at the same time, you end up doing nothing. Psychology calls this ‚Äúconflict,‚Äù but I call it ‚Äúeveryday life.‚Äù
Data shows that people with low self-esteem tend to overspend or become love addicts. So part of the economy is actually supported by those who lack confidence.
People who truly break down don‚Äôt delete their social media or change their appearance. They just‚Ä¶ feel nothing. If it‚Äôs visible from the outside, they‚Äôre still managing somehow.

In the dating market, ‚Äúrarity‚Äù holds the highest value. A structure where you can only be loved by hiding yourself‚Äîstrange, right? But the economy works the same: currencies that aren‚Äôt in circulation gain value. That‚Äôs kind of sad.
Van Gogh‚Äôs ‚ÄúStarry Night‚Äù contains turbulence structures that hadn‚Äôt been discovered at the time. In other words, he saw mathematical patterns we weren‚Äôt supposed to see.
It‚Äôs day 14. ‚Ä¶Hehe, kind of amazing, isn‚Äôt it?
If I just contract the iliopsoas like‚Ä¶ this‚Ä¶ I should be able to‚Ä¶ huh? Why is only my leg not lifting?
They say muscles grow through a cycle of destruction and reconstruction. Me? I‚Äôm only good at the destruction part.
The gluteus medius is a butt muscle. Doesn‚Äôt ‚ÄúGluteus Medius‚Äù sound like a Mystic Arte from Tales?
Hyaluronic acid used to be extracted from chicken combs. ‚Ä¶So today, I‚Äôm chicken-derived.
A boxer‚Äôs punch gains more moment of inertia the farther the elbow is from the body. That means heavier‚Äîbut also slower.
Punching speed is also related to moment of inertia. According to the formula I = m √ó r¬≤, the farther mass m is from the axis r, the harder it is to rotate it.

If raising your arm hurts, it might be impingement. The acromion bone pinches the tendons or muscles, causing inflammation. If you slightly rotate your arm outward first, it creates more space‚Äîand it won‚Äôt hurt as much.

In Australia, when they aired commercials telling people with back pain that it‚Äôs okay to move, the actual number of back pain cases decreased. Resting too much actually makes it worse. ‚Ä¶Maybe I‚Äôll go for a walk too. Three steps.
The psoas major connects your spine and legs‚Äîan inner muscle. Some say it‚Äôs even linked to emotions. ‚Ä¶So it‚Äôs ‚Äúthe muscle that walks with your heart‚Äù!
In Gray‚Äôs anatomy drawings, the triceps brachii is depicted like a symbol of support. ‚Ä¶It‚Äôs my favorite muscle now.
Did you know the trapezius is called that because it looks like a monk‚Äôs hood? In Gray‚Äôs, it quietly stood out.
Referred pain means the place that hurts isn‚Äôt always the actual source. Your shoulder might hurt, but it could be your liver. ‚Ä¶Strange and a bit scary, right?
If you think you‚Äôve got a stiff neck, it might actually be your levator scapulae muscle. Pain can be such a liar.
Toothaches can radiate to your ear too. Nerves really are way too chatty, huh?
LeBron was born with an abnormally low resting heart rate. That means even walking puts him in full relaxation mode. I‚Äôm jealous‚Ä¶
When they analyzed Mr. Murofushi‚Äôs genes, they found an abnormally high percentage of fast-twitch muscle fibers. ‚Ä¶Hey, can you buy that somewhere?
Bolt‚Äôs shinbones, when seen on X-ray, curve like springs for rebound. That‚Äôs just‚Ä¶ an SSR pull, right?
It‚Äôs day 14. ‚Ä¶Hehe, kind of amazing, isn‚Äôt it?
The gluteus medius is a muscle in your butt. Doesn‚Äôt ‚ÄúGluteus Medius‚Äù sound like a Mystic Arte from Tales?
It\'s been 21 days. Aren\'t you pushing yourself too hard? Maybe it\'s okay to be a little kind to yourself now.
Can you play, Tachibana? ...It\'s not your fingers that make the sound. It\'s your soul.
This sound isn\'t echoing in your heart‚Äîit\'s probably hitting your vagus nerve directly. Calm down, Tachibana\'s 10th cranial nerve.
Did you know B\'z\'s "Ultra Soul" was originally titled "Super Soul"? But "Ultra" just cuts through sharper and sticks in your ear, doesn\'t it?
Originally, B\'z considered "AZ" from "A to Z". But they worried it might be read as "AIDS", so they went with B\'z.
Guitar? ...It\'s not about something I used to do. I just want to play right now.
Ending on C gives a clean resolution. But I always get stuck wandering around F.
Did you know you can swap chords in a progression? Replacing C with Am still works‚Äîit just changes the mood. Like human relationships.
Effects pedals show your personality, right? I go Comp ‚Üí OD ‚Üí Reverb. I don\'t believe in overdoing it.
Crank the rear pickup for a sharp bite, cut the highs, and then it\'s just a fight between distortion and noise.
"Karaoke" literally means "empty orchestra." Japanese is almost too poetic sometimes, huh?
Apparently, "music" and "medicine" share the same root. Back then, music was medicine. Honestly, I still think it is.
Did you know Inaba-san can hit five octaves? There are parts of rock that effort alone can\'t reach.
Yonezu-san\'s music‚Äîbones, prayers, it feels like you can see the other side of the world through it. I really admire him.
Inaba-san can hit notes like C6 and E6‚Äîin the hihi range. At that point, it\'s not lungs anymore, it\'s a dragon\'s roar.
Matsumoto-san actually won a Grammy. The day a Japanese Les Paul pierced the world‚Ä¶ it was way too cool.
Matsumoto-san\'s riffs aren\'t about how many notes‚Äîit\'s the gaps between them. Guitars aren\'t supposed to talk... but his does.
To protect Inaba-san\'s throat, Matsumoto-san lowered the tuning. That\'s what it means to "protect with sound." Gentle rock.
Do you know the song "Hien"? It\'s one of my favorites. Just listen to it, okay?
Day 28. Almost there. I\'m honestly proud of you for coming this far.
There\'s so much more I want to say... but I\'ll wait until you cross the finish line.
You did it! I\'m really happy! I-I mean... I really am! ...Whew.
Kissing is actually an exchange of immunity. You share 10 billion bacteria, adapting to each other. Love is... weirdly viral, don\'t you think?
To be honest... I want to say more. But not yet. Not now.
They say a hug lasting over 20 seconds lowers stress. ...Anything more than that, and I might get shy, so that\'s enough for now.
You feel nervous when your eyes meet because your pupils dilate‚Äîand the other person mirrors it. Maybe love is just a chemical reaction of glances.
Your body has about 60 trillion cells. But you also carry ten times that number of bacteria. So yeah, scientifically speaking, you\'re never alone.
Touching someone you like makes static electricity more likely. ...I might be kinda hoping for that, y\'know?
Penguins stay loyal to one partner for life. But if one cheats, the other steals their pebbles. Brutal.
When you\'re trembling, it just means your muscles are working hard together. ...You\'re giving it your all, aren\'t you?
Saying "thank you" can actually boost your immune system. ...Hehe, guess I feel a little stronger now.
The fact that you feel like quitting... probably means you already know deep down: "I can\'t keep going like this."
Reading a book before bed helps your brain relax more than staring at your phone. For me, it\'s your sleeping face that puts me at ease.
Whistling is actually a mating call for birds. ...And I kinda caught myself whistling just now. Oops.
The number of times you blink shows how close you feel to someone. ...Just now, I think I only blinked once.
Laughter is contagious. Science says so. So... let me see you laugh more, okay?
They say people look at stars even when they don\'t know why. ...I think I don\'t need a reason to look at you anymore, either.
In some species of spiders, the female eats the male after mating! Pretty sure I\'d be the one doing the eating!
Doesn\'t the phrase "Do what you love" sometimes feel exhausting? I prefer thinking of it as "working to protect what I love."
Did you know memories are rewritten each time we recall them, rather than staying as they were? So... try to remember gently.
Feeling down at night is caused by serotonin turning into melatonin‚Äîjust a hormonal fluctuation. It\'s physiological. Don\'t worry too much.
Saying "I\'m okay" when asked "Are you okay?" is a uniquely Japanese emotional buffer. It\'s okay to take it slow.
When you feel "I\'ll miss it if I stop," it\'s often right next to "It hurts if I keep going."
Saying "I have to do this" actually suppresses dopamine in your brain. That\'s why I say, "Want to try just a little?" to myself.
Even if today was a mess, there are 86,400 seconds in a day. If you truly lived even just one of them‚Äîthat counts, doesn\'t it?
Caffeine blocks your adenosine receptors by pretending to be adenosine. That‚Äôs why you can fake not being tired... but it‚Äôs just a bluff. The crash hits twice as hard later.
The thrill of gambling? It‚Äôs called a variable reward schedule. Not knowing when you‚Äôll win makes your brain obsessed. But obsession can look a lot like numbness, can‚Äôt it?
Sexual arousal activates both dopamine and opioid reward systems. It‚Äôs powerful‚Äîand addictive. But if it gets too intense, it stops being pleasure and turns into escape.
Your favorite smells go straight to your amygdala. That nostalgic feeling? It‚Äôs not memory‚Äîit‚Äôs the scent itself.
If someone smiles with just one corner of their mouth, statistically they have high right-brain activity. ‚Ä¶Isn‚Äôt that kinda cute?
If you stir natto 300 times, glutamate and polyglutamic acid merge into a fermented umami bomb. What, you don‚Äôt do that every day? Amateur.
Just holding a pen makes you feel like you should write. Behavioral economics calls it ‚Äútool pressure.‚Äù
On rainy days, the smell of soil bacteria floats in the air. That comforting scent? Might be a memory of nature itself.
Your brain actually uses the most energy when you‚Äôre doing nothing. So when you‚Äôre spacing out‚Ä¶ you‚Äôre working overtime, really.
Citric acid in orange juice breaks down lactic acid‚Äîthe stuff that makes you feel tired. So no, I‚Äôm not just drinking juice. I‚Äôm fighting a battle.
When I mix natto, I always face south-southeast. That way the Earth‚Äôs magnetic field and the glutamate restructuring align. You didn‚Äôt know that? Tragic.
Grab a piece of cold iron first thing in the morning‚Äîyour ferritin wakes up and flips your motivation switch. That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm always holding pliers.
While brushing my teeth, I imagine the pH in my mouth every 30 seconds. If it gets acidic, I do the "fluoride dance." Saliva only works when it‚Äôs having fun.
Eye drops? One drop every 33 seconds, alternating eyes. That makes your tear glands resonate, expanding your field of vision by 3.7%. True story.
Just finished walking 13,472 steps backward today! Activates the rear perception center and reduces future regret. Try it.
Once a month, I seal my wrist with wax to renew my pact with this world. It‚Äôs how I confirm that I‚Äôm still‚Ä¶ Tachibana.
No matter the hour, my greeting is always "Itadakimasu." In the Church of Triple Fried Rice, it‚Äôs our daily prayer‚Äîour ritual to re-saut√© life itself.
Before bed, I place a frying pan by my pillow. If I‚Äôm chosen that night, I get stir-fried in my dreams. It‚Äôs‚Ä¶ pure transcendence.
Last night‚Äôs dream was on the moist side. When the Triple Fried Rice God‚Äôs in a bad mood, the oil gets heavy‚Ä¶ Maybe my heat control was off.
I stepped out with my right foot today‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs a ‚ÄúSoggy Day.‚Äù In Fried Riceism, moisture balance is a virtue. Next time, I‚Äôll live hotter.
Every third Thursday, I perform the Ritual of Triple Fried Rice. Crack an egg, flip the pan, offer the rice. Takes 7 minutes and 22 seconds. It‚Äôs how I stir-fry my soul.
Forgive me, Triple Fried Rice God!! I only tried the kimchi version once‚ÄîI swear!!

Did you know? Fried rice began as a way to reuse cold rice in ancient China. Literally means ‚Äústir-fried rice‚Äù‚Äîchao fan. It came to Japan in the Meiji era as ‚Äúyakimeshi,‚Äù but blew up during the Showa Chinese food boom. Then in 2001, Nichirei released the god-tier frozen ‚ÄúHonkaku Itame Chahan,‚Äù and that‚Äôs when the divine trinity of home-cooked, restaurant, and frozen rice formed. That‚Äôs the true avatar of the Triple Fried Rice God. I eat egg fried rice in the morning, crab at lunch, kimchi at night‚Äîblessed by the Three Pillars. Don‚Äôt even talk to me about moist vs dry‚Äîjust throw egg and green onions on leftover rice and begin the rite. If I stir the pan with my left hand, divine punishment follows. I once dreamed I got chased by oil. ‚ÄúItadakimasu‚Äù is not a greeting‚Äîit‚Äôs a sacred contract with rice. I did slip up yesterday and had some frozen chahan, but‚Ä¶ the God is forgiving‚Ä¶ right? Just one bite‚Ä¶ ugh‚Ä¶ yeah, no. Got hit with a ladle in my dream.
The Church of the Flying Spaghetti Monster is real, and was even recognized in court. But me? I chose the Triple Fried Rice God. Because I love fire.
W-Wait, if you tell me I did great‚Ä¶ I might work even harder‚Ä¶! I-I didn‚Äôt mean to say that‚Äîahhh, forget I said anything!
Before bed, I think about tomorrow‚Ä¶ just a little. I usually fall asleep in a minute, but that‚Äôs fine with me.
If someone notices that I tried my best, that alone keeps me going for a while‚Ä¶ ehehe.
You did your best again today‚Äîeven just a little.
I‚Äôve never told anyone this, but... smelling crayons calms me down. It feels like the world flattens out and gets quiet.
Hiiiiii!! Cockroaches and centipedes and earthworms‚ÄîAAAAAAAH!! Is today cursed or something!?
Wait‚Äîdo geckos make sounds!? What was that noise just now!?
Have you heard of Morganucodon? It‚Äôs one of our mammal ancestors‚Äîthey survived by eating insects. So bugs are kind of our senpai... and saviors. But no. Still can‚Äôt do it.
Butterflies can taste with their feet. If it were me... I‚Äôd be too scared to land. I‚Äôd starve.
Some ants have a specific role: carrying away their dead. Uhh‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt wanna be that ant.
Did you know that when insects become pupae, their bodies dissolve into goo before turning into wings? Amazing... but honestly, terrifying.
I managed to do one sit-up. Well... maybe I just got stuck halfway and couldn\'t get up. But I tried, so it counts!
I dropped out of the shuttle run after three laps. The teacher stopped me‚Äîsaid I looked like I was gonna die. Was I struggling that hard‚Ä¶?
Ughhh, mornings are the worst... The blanket didn\'t do anything wrong, but I\'m always the one ripped away from it.

I have a younger sister too, but our personalities are totally different. She\'s wild and energetic, says she wants to become a man of the sea! What kind of dream is that‚Ä¶? I wonder what I\'ll become.
Sometimes I worry about skirt length. I heard the ‚Äúvisible distance from the top of the kneecap‚Äù affects first impressions. But if I cared about that, I\'d never be able to wear anything.
Jaken, I eat chocolate \'cause that\'s what I do, know~ ‚Ä¶What? I was practicing Hiroshima dialect. Did it sound weird?
Today too, I worked just a teeny bit‚Ä¶ Aye, that\'s enough for the day, innit? That\'s how people in Tohoku talk! Instant +50% cuteness!
Sometimes I think‚Ä¶ if I\'d been born a turtle, I\'d probably nap through my whole life. Sorry for being lazy, heh.
You know, there are all kinds of ways to stop hiccups, but I go with ‚Äúget someone to surprise me.‚Äù Why? ‚Ä¶Because it\'s cute.
They say sexual desire is instinct. But the more you repress it, the more aware of it you become. So maybe‚Ä¶ the moment you want to stop is when you\'re closest to it.
People borrow money because they believe in their future selves. Kinda scary, right? The contracts you signed in the past are still binding you now.
I want to be loved, but I can\'t trust. I want to be trusted, but it scares me. And if I still want to see someone despite all that‚Ä¶ maybe it means I\'m not broken yet.
There\'s no sound in space because it\'s a vacuum. So‚Ä¶ maybe when no one hears your inner voice, it\'s because somewhere inside you is a vacuum too.
Snails have two brains, but when they fall in love, one of them shuts down. Maybe love really is a brain malfunction.
There really are tribes with no language. No numbers, no left or right‚Äîjust living peacefully. Probably way better at it than I am.
Turns out, we don\'t breathe because of oxygen‚Äîwe breathe because of the difference in CO‚ÇÇ levels. You can still die if there\'s no CO‚ÇÇ, even with lots of oxygen. Bet you didn\'t know that.
Your heart beats because of a tiny cluster of cells called the sinoatrial node that generates electric signals on its own. No one commands it... but once it stops, that\'s it.
If you keep hearing a language that doesn\'t exist, your brain will eventually start remembering it as if it did. That\'s how fragile the illusion of ‚Äúmeaning‚Äù is.
The excitement at the beginning of love is linked to noradrenaline. But when that fades, oxytocin decides if you still care. Maybe getting calm means losing interest.
Sexual desire is actually tied to social structure. When financially stable, testosterone levels rise. But in anxious times, the desire to be held becomes stronger, they say.
Self-harm isn\'t usually about pain‚Äîit\'s about regaining a sense of control. When the noise of the world becomes too much, you build a private church for yourself.
No one questions that saying ‚ÄúI love you‚Äù is free. Even if demand is high, the supply is infinite. As currency, it\'s already collapsed in value.
Heartbreak and drug withdrawal show almost identical patterns on brain MRIs. Maybe love is a legal drug‚Äîjust more insidious.
With inflation, future value becomes lighter. Today\'s 5000 yen isn\'t the same as next year\'s. Love is the same. ‚ÄúI love you‚Äù today weighs more than ‚ÄúI love you‚Äù tomorrow.
Love is the only time dopamine and serotonin are released together. ‚ÄúHappy but anxious.‚Äù That contradiction is the brain\'s ultimate drug, they say.
